intro: Ageratina bobjansenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small blue or purple clouds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ageratina bobjansenii is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in the ecological diversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
